summary: This is a Director's Awards nomination form for a prosecution team from the U.S. Attorney's Office, recognizing their work in the investigation and prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. It details the multi-year effort, the scope of the crimes, the legal strategies, and the team's collaboration to secure Maxwell's conviction after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's girlfriend, business partner, and co-conspirator who recruited, groomed, and enticed minor girls for abuse, and directly participated in abuse. She was convicted in December 2021.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a perpetrator who, with Maxwell, ran a sex trafficking and abuse scheme targeting hundreds of minor girls between 1994 and 2004. He was arrested in July 2019 and died by suicide before trial.

connections.description: Described as girlfriend, business partner, and co-conspirator in a sex trafficking and abuse scheme spanning years.
Both are described as perpetrators who targeted, groomed, and abused hundreds of minor victims together.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and Indictment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and charged with sex trafficking and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while in custody prior to his trial.

events.title: Maxwell Conviction
events.description: Following a month-long trial, Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted on multiple counts including conspiracy to entice minors, transport minors, commit sex trafficking, and substantive counts of transportation and sex trafficking.

events.title: Maxwell Sentencing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was sentenced to an unspecified term of incarceration.

events.title: Start of Criminal Scheme
events.description: The sex abuse and trafficking scheme perpetrated by Epstein and Maxwell began.

events.title: End of Criminal Scheme
events.description: The sex abuse and trafficking scheme perpetrated by Epstein and Maxwell ended.

keyFacts: The prosecution team's investigation revealed a sex trafficking and abuse scheme by Epstein and Maxwell that affected 'more than one hundred' and 'hundreds' of minor victims between 1994 and 2004.
The scheme is described as a 'pyramid scheme of sexual abuse' where minor girls were paid for 'massages' that escalated to abuse, and were then paid to recruit other victims.

The investigation involved over a dozen search warrants (including for an entire private island), seizure of dozens of electronic devices containing terabytes of data, and more than 400 interviews of over 150 witnesses across multiple states and two foreign countries.
Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted in December 2021 on multiple counts including conspiracy and substantive charges related to the enticement, transportation, and sex trafficking of minors.
Jeffrey Epstein was charged in July 2019 but died by suicide before trial; the investigation into Maxwell continued and intensified after his death.
